page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Shepton Mallet "North" is similar in most respects to areas in it's immediate vicinity. It consists for the most part of gently undulating countryside, roughly 200 meters above sea-level,rising to a maximum height of 297 meters. The soil is slightly acidic and rather sandy. The underlying rock is limestone. The buildings are of local stone i.e. limestone. The main landuse is dairy farming with a small area of deciduous forest. The rest of the land is occupied mainly by residential cottages. There is a radio mast in this area which is used by the water authority to alter the flow of piped water underground.
